Package ohos.media.camera.device

Interface CameraAbility


  • public interface CameraAbility
    Queries static abilities of the camera.

    Obtain a CameraAbility object by calling CameraKit.getCameraAbility(String). The CameraAbility object is used to describe static abilities of a logical or physical camera.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Multimedia#CAMERA

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  CameraAbility.CameraRunningMode
      Describes camera running mode types.

    • Method Detail

      • getSupportedFormats

        List<Integer> getSupportedFormats​()
        Obtains the list of supported output image formats.
        Returns:
        Returns the list if any supported format is obtained; returns an empty list otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • getSupportedSizes

        List<Size> getSupportedSizes​(int format)
        Gets supported output image sizes based on a specified format.
        Parameters:
        format - Indicates an output image format, which is defined by ImageFormat.

        Note that not all the defined formats are supported.

        Returns:
        Returns the supported sizes matching the specified output image format; returns a list with the length of 0 if the specified format is not supported.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        ImageFormat

      • getSupportedSizes

        <T> List<Size> getSupportedSizes​(Class<T> clazz)
        Gets supported output image sizes based on a specified class type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Indicates a class type.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Indicates a referenced Class object that is not null.

        Only SurfaceOps, and Recorder are supported.

        Returns:
        Returns the resolution matching the specified class; returns a list with the length of 0 if the specified class is not supported.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if clazz is null.
        Since:
        3

      • getSupportedAfMode

        int[] getSupportedAfMode​()
        Gets autofocus (AF) modes supported by the camera.

        Check supported AF modes before setting an AF mode by calling FrameConfig.Builder#setAfMode(int, Rect).

        Returns:
        Returns supported AF modes; returns an array with the length of 0 if AF is not supported.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Metadata.AfMode, FrameConfig.Builder.setAfMode(int, Rect)

      • getSupportedAeMode

        int[] getSupportedAeMode​()
        Gets auto exposure (AE) modes supported by the camera.

        Check supported AE modes before setting an AE mode by calling FrameConfig.Builder#setAeMode(int, Rect)

        Returns:
        Returns AE modes supported by the camera; returns an array with the length of 0 if AE is not supported.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        FrameConfig.Builder.setAeMode(int, Rect)

      • getSupportedAwbMode

        int[] getSupportedAwbMode​()
        Gets the auto white balance (AWB) modes supported by this camera.

        You should call this method before setting an AWB mode via FrameConfig.Builder#setAwbMode(int, Rect).

        Returns:
        Returns the supported AWB modes if any; returns an empty array otherwise.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        FrameConfig.Builder.setAwbMode(int, Rect)

      • getSupportedZoom

        float[] getSupportedZoom​()
        Gets the zoom range supported by the camera.

        Check the supported zoom range before setting a zoom value by calling FrameConfig.Builder#setZoom(float).

        If the camera supports zoom, the return value is array [minZoom, maxZoom], indicating the supported zoom range. The array length is fixed at 2. If the camera does not support zoom, [1.0f, 1.0f] is returned.

        The zoom value can be any floating-point number in the range. The larger the zoom value is, the higher times an image is zoomed.

        If the camera supports long-focus zoom and the zoom value exceeds a certain threshold, such as 3.0f or 5.0f, the camera automatically switch to the long-focus lens.

        Returns:
        Returns the supported zoom range.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        FrameConfig.Builder.setZoom(float)

      • getSupportedFlashMode

        int[] getSupportedFlashMode​()
        Gets the supported flash modes.

        Check supported flash modes before setting a flash mode by calling FrameConfig.Builder#setFlashMode(int).

        The returned values indicate supported flash modes, for example, {FLASH_AUTO, FLASH_CLOSE}.

        Returns:
        Returns the supported flash modes; returns an array with the length of 0 if no flash mode is not supported.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        FrameConfig.Builder.setFlashMode(int), Metadata.FlashMode

      • getSupportedFaceDetection

        int[] getSupportedFaceDetection​()
        Gets the supported face detection types.

        Check the supported face detection types before setting the function by calling FrameConfig.Builder#setFaceDetection(int, boolean).

        The return value indicates supported face detection types. The array length is the number of supported types, for example, {FACE_DETECTION, FACE_SMILE_DETECTION}.

        Returns:
        Returns the supported face detection types; returns an array with the length of 0 if face detection is not supported.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        FrameConfig.Builder.setFaceDetection(int, boolean), Metadata.FaceDetectionType

      • getSupportedParameters

        List<ParameterKey.Key<?>> getSupportedParameters​()
        Gets parameters supported by the camera.

        Check supported parameters are before setting them by calling FrameConfig.Builder#setParameter(ParameterKey.Key, Object).

        Returns:
        Returns the supported parameters; returns a list with the length of 0 if the camera does not support parameter settings.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        FrameConfig.Builder.setParameter(ParameterKey.Key, Object)

      • getParameterRange

        <T> List<T> getParameterRange​(ParameterKey.Key<T> parameter)
        Gets the value range of a specified parameter.

        Check valid values of the parameters before setting them by calling FrameConfig.Builder#setParameter(ParameterKey.Key, Object).

        Type Parameters:
        T - Indicates a value type of the parameters.
        Parameters:
        parameter - Indicates the parameters supported by the camera.
        Returns:
        Returns value ranges of the supported parameters.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        FrameConfig.Builder.setParameter(ParameterKey.Key, Object)

      • getSupportedResults

        List<ResultKey.Key<?>> getSupportedResults​()
        Gets the keys of returnable results related to the parameter settings supported by the camera.
        Returns:
        Returns keys of returnable results related to the parameter settings supported by the camera; returns a list with the length of 0 if no key is obtained.
        Since:
        1

      • getSupportedProperties

        List<PropertyKey.Key<?>> getSupportedProperties​()
        Gets camera properties.

        The properties are used to describe camera's inherent information, instead of controlling the camera, for example, PropertyKey#SENSOR_ORIENTATION.

        Returns:
        Returns the camera properties; returns a list with the length of 0 if the camera does not have property information.
        Since:
        1

      • getPropertyValue

        <T> T getPropertyValue​(PropertyKey.Key<T> property)
        Gets the value of a specified property.

        Check supported properties by calling CameraAbility#getSupportedProperties() before this method.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Indicates the data type of the property.
        Parameters:
        property - Indicates properties supported by the camera.
        Returns:
        Returns the value of the static property.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if property is null.
        Since:
        1

      • getSupportedRunningModes

        int[] getSupportedRunningModes​()
        Obtains the running modes supported by the camera.

        You should obtain the supported running modes before setting any mode via CameraConfig.Builder#setRunningMode(int).

        Returns:
        Returns the supported running modes if any; returns an empty array otherwise.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        CameraConfig.Builder.setRunningMode(int)

      • getSupportedHighFrameRate

        List<Scope<Integer>> getSupportedHighFrameRate​(int format,
                                               Size size)
        Obtains the range of high frame rates supported by a specified image format and resolution.

        High frame rates refer to the frame rates greater than 30 fps. The range of them can be discontinuous.

        Parameters:
        format - Indicates the output image format, which is defined by ImageFormat.
        size - Indicates the image resolution.
        Returns:
        Returns the range in a Scope list if there is any high frame rate supported; returns an empty list if format or size is not supported.
        Since:
        4

      • getSupportedHighFrameRate

        <T> List<Scope<Integer>> getSupportedHighFrameRate​(Class<T> clazz,
                                                   Size size)
        Obtains the range of high frame rates supported by a specified Class object and resolution.

        High frame rates refer to the frame rates greater than 30 fps. The range of them can be discontinuous.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Indicates a class type.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Indicates a referenced Class object that is not null.
        Returns:
        Returns the range in a Scope list if there is any high frame rate supported; returns an empty list if clazz or size is not supported.
        Since:
        4

      • getSupportedHighSizes

        List<Size> getSupportedHighSizes​(int format)
        Obtains the list of high resolutions at frame rates of less than 30 fps.
        Parameters:
        format - Indicates the output image format, which is defined by ImageFormat.
        Returns:
        Returns the list if there is any high resolution supported at frame rates of less than 30 fps;returns an empty list otherwise.
        Since:
        4

        size - Indicates the image resolution.

      • isFormatSupported

        boolean isFormatSupported​(int format)
        Checks whether a specified format is supported for image output.

        Not all formats defined in ImageFormat are supported.

        Parameters:
        format - Indicates an output image format, which is defined in ImageFormat.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the format is supported; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        ImageFormat

      • isSurfaceClassSupported

        <T> boolean isSurfaceClassSupported​(Class<T> clazz)
        Checks whether the surface class is supported.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Indicates a generic type of the surface class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Indicates the class of the surface.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the surface class is supported; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5
